definition: to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
surname Huai
to hate/to regret
to harbor hard feelings

sentences.english: "Simon, you will be hated by 1.3 billion Chinese," someone wrote in response to my blog post about the chaotic progress of the Olympic torch through London.
sentences.chinese: 西蒙，13億中國人民會對你懷恨在心。

sentences.english: I know she cherishes a secret resentment against me.
sentences.chinese: 我知道她對我懷恨在心。

sentences.english: WenSheng see DuSiMan renege on her more grudge.
sentences.chinese: 文勝見杜思曼食言對她更加懷恨。
我知道你對我懷恨在心。

sentences.english: Your grudge-holding will destroy your happiness.
sentences.chinese: 懷恨在心會摧毀你的幸福。

sentences.english: A: I know you hate me.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你對我懷恨在心。

sentences.english: 19So Herodias nursed a grudge against John and wanted to kill him. But she was not able to
sentences.chinese: 於是希羅底懷恨他，想要殺他，只是不能。

sentences.english: He had been a spiteful sort of man.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個善於懷恨的男人。

sentences.english: He bears a grudge against me because I took his place in the team.
sentences.chinese: 他對我懷恨在心，因爲我取代了他在隊裏的位置。

sentences.english: I know Diego appreciates me and I don't hold any grudges.
sentences.chinese: 我知道迭戈欣賞我，我也沒有懷恨於他。

sentences.english: She still nursed a grudge against her old enemy.
sentences.chinese: 她對自己的宿仇仍然懷恨在心。

definition: to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
(Buddhism) predestined relationship
to have no sense of shame/brazen
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
flying squirrel/(dialect) bat
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
lit. to use the eastern wind (idiom)/fig. to use sb's help
to upbraid
to involve others (in a crime)/guilt by association
long-cherished wish
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
